definition: to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
surname Li
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: He always sows dragon's teeth between them.
sentences.chinese: 他總是在他們之間挑撥離間。

sentences.english: He sowed discord among his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他在朋友中間挑撥離間。

sentences.english: All they wanted was to make bad blood between them, aggravate differences and fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 他們就是要挑撥離間，擴大分歧，以便渾水摸魚。

sentences.english: I think you are instigating Dr. Dirt to form a negative feeling toward me.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲妳是在挑撥離間阿土博士和我的感情。

sentences.english: Mrs Smith enjoys setting people at loggerheads.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯太太喜歡挑撥離間。

sentences.english: All they wanted was to make bad blood between them and fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 他們所要做的就是挑撥離間，混水摸魚。

sentences.english: He is sowing discord among his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他在朋友中間挑撥離間。

sentences.english: These dodgy documents could allow mischief-makers to impersonate supposedly secure websites.
sentences.chinese: 挑撥離間者可用這些虛假的許可證冒充安全網站。

definition: to exaggerate
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
crafty/slippery/slyboots
riffraff/scum/lowlife/despicable/inferior
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
to have no sense of shame/brazen
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
